info.name: Imburse API
info.description:
Welcome to the Imburse API. You can use our APIs to access Identity, Management, and Transaction API endpoints.

The API is organized around REST. Our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts form-encoded request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs.

For more information on the API, including Core Concepts, a Getting Started Guide, and Tutorials, please read the [developers documentation](https://developers.imbursepayments.com) 

You can use the Imburse API in sandbox mode, which does not affect your live data.

# Endpoints
All API urls refer to a **{{baseApiUrl}}** placeholder value.

Replace this with either:

- Sandbox API endpoint: **https://api-sandbox.imbursepayments.com**
- Production API endpoint: **https://api.imbursepayments.com**

# Error Codes
Imburse uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of an API request. In general, codes in the **2xx** range indicate success, codes in the **4xx** range indicate an error that failed given the information provided (e.g., a required parameter was omitted, etc.), and codes in the **5xx** range indicate an error with Imburse's servers,

Response Code | Meaning
--------------| -------
200 | **OK** - Everything worked as expected.
201 | **Created** - The request created a valid entity.
202 | **Accepted** - The request was accepted.
204 | **No Content** - The request was successful but no content should be expected back.
400 | **Bad Request** - The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter.
401 | **Unauthorized** - No valid API key provided.
402 | **Request Failed** - The parameters were valid but the request failed.
403 | **Forbidden** -- The requested endpoint is not valid for your user or role.
404 | **Not Found** - The requested resource doesn't exist.
409 | **Conflict** - The request conflicts with another request (perhaps due to using the same idempotent key).
429 | **Too Many Requests**	- Too many requests hit the API too quickly. We recommend an exponential backoff of your requests.
500, 501, 502, 503, 504 | **Internal Server Error** - Something went wrong on Imburse's end.

# Error Handling
All `400 - Bad Request` responses will return a structured response containing one or more error codes:

For example:

```json
{
    "errorCodes": [
        "SCHEME_ID_INVALID",
        "SCHEME_NAME_REQUIRED"
    ]
}
```

Your original request will need to be fixed before resubmitting.

# Access Control
Each API method in is decorated with a *Role required* attribute. To execute any API methods successfully, your API Key would need to have the role name specified added to the `roles` property or a role that gives the eqivalent permissions sush as `tenant-admin` or `account-admin`.

See the [Account Management - Account Roles](https://developers.imbursepayments.com/pages/getting-started/account-management/#account-roles) and [Account Management - Tenant Roles](https://developers.imbursepayments.com/pages/getting-started/account-management/#tenant-roles) for lists of the available roles.

# Correlation IDs
Each API request has an associated correlation identifier. You can find this value in the response object under `correlation-id` when errors in the range 500 are returned.

You can also pass in your own **custom** correlation identifier into the request header `X-Correlation-ID`.

If you need to contact us about a specific request, providing the correlation identifier will ensure the fastest possible resolution.

# Metadata
The Payment Order objects have a metadata parameter. You can use this parameter to attach key-value data to these Imburse objects.

Metadata is useful for storing additional, structured information on an object. As an example, you could store your user's full name and corresponding unique identifier from your system on a Imburse Payment Order object. Metadata is not used by Imburse. We will simply return your metadata to you in webhook responses relating to the Payment Order. You can then use this to give added context to your webhook response.

Do not store any sensitive information (personally identifiable information, card details, etc.) as metadata.

# Versioning
When we make backwards-incompatible changes to the API, we release new, numbered versions. The current version is **V1**. When a new version is released we will post an API upgrade guide and changelog.

item.name: Identity API Reference

exec: var unsignedSignature = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + bodySignature;
var hmac = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + signedSignature;

request.description:
#### Description

Creates a new Management API bearer token from a given HMAC token. Please see [HMAC Authentication](#hmac-authentication) for more details.

exec: var unsignedSignature = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + bodySignature;
var hmac = publicKey + ":" + nonce + ":" + timestamp + ":" + signedSignature;

request.description:
#### Description

Creates a new Payout API bearer token from a given HMAC token. Please see [HMAC Authentication](#hmac-authentication) for more details.

item.description:
This API describes how to create the three types of Bearer Token for our API's.

They are all based on the HMAC authentication scheme.

request.description:
#### Description

Gets the current account assigned to the access token.

#### Role required

`account-management-read`

#### Description

Creates a new account key to access account level API's.

#### Role required

`account-api-key-write`

#### Description

Gets the existing account public keys and claims assigned to them. Private keys are not returned.

#### Role required

`account-api-key-read`

#### Description

Gets a certain account key by its public key.

#### Role required

`account-api-key-read`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
publicKey | The public key of the desired account key

#### Description

Delete a Key.

#### Role required

`account-api-key-write`

#### Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
publicKey | The public key of the account keyset to delete.

#### Description

Creates a new tenant.

#### Role required

`account-tenant-write`

query.description: Index you want to take from. Default is 0.
How many results to bring back. Default is 20.
Optional - Filter by a tenant name. Default is nothing.

request.description:
#### Description

Gets all the tenants for this account.

#### Role required

`account-tenant-read`

#### Optional Params

Parameter | Description
--------- | -----------
from | The index to take from. Default is 0.
take | Amount of results to return. Default us 20.
name | Tenant Name to filter by.

request.description:
#### Description

Gets a list of all the rewards from the catalog.

#### Role required

`tenant-catalog-read`

response.name: Get all Rewards
response.body:
{
    "rewards": [
        {
            "rewardId": "6a30bdaa-483a-2b3f-e28e-0158d0cf07c2",
            "rewardName": "Amazon.de Kupony",
            "brandName": "Amazon.de Poland",
            "appId": "TANGOCARD_RAAS",
            "appName": "Tango Card RaaS",
            "countries": [
                "PL"
            ],
            "currencyCode": "EUR",
            "isWholeAmountValueRequired": false,
            "valueType": "VARIABLE_VALUE",
            "fixedValue": null,
            "maxValue": 5000,
            "minValue": 0.01,
            "imageUrl": "https://dwwvg90koz96l.cloudfront.net/images/brands/b050503-80w-326ppi.png"
        }
    ]
}

query.description: Mandatory. An App Id of an previously installed app that supplies the rewards. ie. TANGOCARD_RAAS
Optional. The brand name to search for.
Optional. The country to search for. ie. DE, FR, GB, CH, etc
Options. The currency to search for. ie. GBP, EUR, USD, etc.
Optional. Filter the rewards that support the specified amount. ie 5, 10, 20 etc. Leave empty to search for all.

request.description:
#### Description

Searches the catalog for rewards that match the given parameters

#### Role required

`tenant-catalog-read`

response.name: Successful request

item.name: Transactions API Reference

request.description:
#### Description

Gets the payout options.

#### Role required

`tenant-transaction-read`

response.name: Get Payout Options

request.description:
#### Description 

Claim a reward.

#### Role required

`tenant-transaction-write`

#### Description 

Check the status of a previous Claim a Reward task id.


Using the `TaskId` returned from the `Claim a Reward` endpoint, poll this endpoint. Expect the following responses:

Response Code | Action to take
-|-
`200 - OK` | Claim still being processed; Poll this endpoint again.
`201 - Created` | Claim has been processed successfully. You can now call the `Redeem a Reward` endpoint.

We would recommend polling every 250ms (1/4 of a second) until the `201 - Created` response is returned. 

There will be variances in processing times depending on your rewards provider.

#### Role required

`tenant-transaction-write`

response.name: Check Task Status - Not yet processed

request.description:
#### Description 

Redeems a reward that has been previously claimed.

#### Role required

`tenant-transaction-write`

response.name: Redeem a Reward

item.description: Use this API for getting the payment options to present to your users and to process the payment instructions.
